title: Spouses Nominating Different Main Residences

scenario_info.name: Spouses Nominating Different Main Residences
scenario_info.description: Chris and Morgan are married but live in different cities for work. Chris lives in Brisbane and Morgan lives in Sydney. They each nominate their respective dwelling as their main residence. Under s118.170, spouses can claim different main residences, but with limitations on the exemption.

expected_result.notes: After 50% discount. Only 50% exemption during period of different main residences.

applicable_rules: ITAA97 s118.170: Spouses living in different main residences
If spouse owns >50% of nominated dwelling, exemption = 50% for period living apart
Chris owns 100%, so only 50% exemption applies during different MR period
If Chris owned 50% or less, would get 100% exemption on their share

property_history.description: Chris and Morgan both establish as main residence initially
Morgan purchases Sydney property and moves there for work. Spouses now have DIFFERENT main residences. Chris's exemption reduced to 50% from this date.

properties.notes: Partial exemption (58.31%). Period 1: Joint main residence (407 days) = 100% exempt. Period 2: Different main residences (2,041 days) = only 50% exempt because Chris owns 100%. Taxable gain after 50% discount: $42,982.

property_history.description: Morgan's property - 100% ownership. Morgan nominates this as main residence.
Morgan moves in as main residence

properties.notes: Morgan's Sydney property - nominated as Morgan's main residence from 15 March 2019. Not sold in this scenario.

user_query: My spouse and I live in different cities for work. I own a property in Brisbane and my spouse owns one in Sydney. We each live in our own property. I'm selling the Brisbane property. What's my CGT?
